author: striker
msg: Simplify some logic in the pools debug code by using a 'nested' lock.
Factor out the code for walking the pools tree.

author: aaron
msg: HPUX 11.0 doesn't have /dev/null, but HPUX 11i does, so it tries to
enable MMAP_ZERO which isn't supported. This is a workaround to
fall back to SHMGET_ANON on hpux11.

author: striker
msg: Trailing whitespace is evil.  This gets rids of it.  Add some comments

author: aaron
msg: HPUX 11.0 doesn't have /dev/null, but HPUX 11i does, so it tries to
enable MMAP_ZERO which isn't supported. This is a workaround to
fall back to SHMGET_ANON on hpux11.

author: brane
msg: Even on NT, a file can be without a DACL -- for example, if it's in a
FAT volume.  In that case, the access rights are effectively 0777,
modulo the readonly bit -- just like they're computed for Win9x.
Before this change, apr_file_info_get would return APR_INCOMPLETE
if APR_FILE_PROT was requested for such files.
